AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Raymond McMillon: defendant, appellant, and passenger in a tractor-trailer with undocumented aliens, convicted of alien transportation offenses, traveled with co-defendant to Laredo, questioned by Agent Pena at an immigration checkpoint, filed a motion to dismiss the indictment on speedy trial grounds, sentenced to 41 months' imprisonment, argues about the lawfulness of Agent Pena's immigration questions, claimed to have a possessory interest in the tractor-trailer due to a commercial purpose, appealed the district court's factual findings
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Zeba Williams: co-defendant, driver of the tractor-trailer, asked McMillon to accompany him to pick up commercial equipment, questioned by Agent Pena at an immigration checkpoint, gave consent for search of tractor's sleeper area, testified about the events during the suppression hearing, voluntarily consented to the search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Luis Pena: Border Patrol Agent who approached the driver-side door at an immigration checkpoint near Freer, Texas, questioned Williams and McMillon, discovered a person hidden in the tractor's sleeper area, testified as a government witness during the jury trial, asked immigration questions, conducted a checkpoint stop within permissible duration, initiated the search of the tractor-trailer, credibly testified about the events
